intro: Oenothera renneri, commonly known as the Renner's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its stems are often glandular and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Oenothera renneri is also known for its ability to produce a large number of seeds, contributing to its reproductive success in its native habitat.
